content.description: Start as for Pot Belly, then veer left where the two cracks diverge.

Gave it a 10- due to being more sustained compared to Just For Starters but you can find some good rests and just make sure you follow the bolts, I misread the guidebook first go thinking it was JFS so went up and left instead of right... Downclimbing and traversing on this makes it much harder than its grade. Could easily be 5.9
Start with the slab moves of the original Pot Belly line, then undercling left until that crack runs out. Angle up and right on face moves to the top of Pot Belly.

climbs.name: Pot Belly
climbs.fa: Bill Griffin and Bruce Price, April 1973

content.description:
This is the first climb that one comes to upon reaching the cliff.

It follows a crack that doesn't reach the ground. Do tricky slab moves up to the crack. Follow this crack (5.7) to a ledge.

A second pitch is rarely done for good reason. If you must try it, move left from the ledge and up a 5.9 crack.
content.protection: Pro to 4" (for anchor and/or second pitch).

climbs.name: Sloth Wall
climbs.fa: Steve Miller, Jerry and Elsie Anderson, 10/72.

content.description:
This climb is up and right of "Pot Belly".

The best approach is to climb "Pot Belly" first pitch, or go up a gully to the right.

Walk right, to the base.

Follow a crack to a flake, then up knobby rock to a belay at a tree, with rap slings.

Either rappel or climb a flake and more knobs to the top.

climbs.name: Knob Hill Ropest
climbs.fa: Chuck Pratt, Tim Auger, Jerry Anderson, 4/73.

content.description:
From the ledge at the top of the "Sloth Wall" is another short wall with a prominent wide crack.

The route follows this crack.

This route was originally called: "Knob Hill Rapist.

Clip the first bolt and then make crux slab move. The climbing then eases and by the time you get into the sea of knobs enjoy the runout bolted 5.3 to the tree. The first move can be easily aided if necessary.
content.protection:
7 bolts to the tree rappel.

The bolts get spaced farther and farther apart as you get closer to the anchors but the climbing gets correspondingly easier.

Decent pine tree with reasonable slings at the top as of October 07.
content.location: The first route just right of the gully that separates the Pot Belly wall and the main Sloth Wall.  I rapped off the tree with a single 50m into the gully,but had to do some downclimbing in the gully to get back to the base.

climbs.name: Deception Gully
climbs.fa: Chuck Pratt, Tim Auger, Jerry Anderson, 4/73.

content.description: This climbs the easy appearing gully/crack, left of "Knob Hill Ropest".
This climb is down and right of "Sloth Wall".Climb a corner and fun crack.Rappel or walk left.

This route is up and right of "Sloth Wall". It climbs a short crack with a tree at the base.Climb the crack then move up and left to the tree on "Sloth Wall" or wander up to the top, directly.Either finish on the Just for Starters tree to rap or finish up and left of the final tree belay. Aim for the light gray pinnacle to left you can see at final belay.
